definition: to annihilate/to exterminate/extinction
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
mass extinction

sentences.english: Pleistocene glaciation caused the extinction of many species.
sentences.chinese: 第四紀冰期，使許多物種絕滅。

sentences.english: Non synergy leads to fall after fall towards extinction thought-form.
sentences.chinese: 非協同，帶來了一次又一次走向絕滅思想形態的跌落。

sentences.english: The butterfly is on the verge of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 枯葉蝶真是因此而要絕對的絕滅了。

sentences.english: Continental Cretaceous-Paleogene strata are important information carriers of this extinction event.
sentences.chinese: 陸相地層是恐龍絕滅等事件信息的重要載體。

sentences.english: Botanists believed that the species is extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 植物學家相信本種已在野外絕滅。

sentences.english: The village would have been completely destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，也許，整個村落會都絕滅了。

definition: wine, sex, avarice and temper (idiom); four cardinal vices
flying squirrel/(dialect) bat
sectarian bias/parochialism
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
Chakravarti raja (Sanskrit: King of Kings)/emperor in Hindu mythology
magical/miraculous/mystical
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
sparing/economical
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
prejudiced/narrow-minded
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
(Buddhism) predestined relationship
method of counting (e.g. decimal or Roman numbers)
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
